publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.incipit:
ተግሣጽ፡ ለኵሉ፡ እጓለ፡ እመሕያው።
ፍካሬ፡ ዘጻድቃን፡ ወዘኃጥአን፡ መዝሙር፡ ዘዳዊት።
፩ ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን።
ወዘኢቆመ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ኃጥአን።
msItem.explicit:
አሜሃ፡ ወድቀ፡ በኃይለ፡ እግዚአብሔር።
ወአንሰ፡ ነሣእኩ፡ ዘእምላዕሌሁ፡ ሰይፈ።
ወመተርኩ፡ ርእሶ፡ ለጎልያድ።
ወአሰሰልኩ፡ ጽዕለተ፡ እምደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ነቢይ፡ ዘቀዳሚት፡ ሕግ።
፩። ንሴብሕ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ስቡሕ፡ ዘተሰብሐ።
ፈረሰ፡ ወመስተፅዕነ፡ ወረወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር።
msItem.explicit:
ወአስተጋብአ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ላዕሌሆሙ፡ ማየ፡ ባሕር።
ወደቂቀ፡ እስራኤልሰ፡ ኃለፉ፡ እንተ፡ የብስ፡ በማዕከለ፡ ባሕር።
ማይሰ፡ ሎመ፡ አረፍት፡ በይምን፡ ወአረፍት፡ በጽግም።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ዘዳግም፡ ሕግ።
፪። አጽምዕ፡ ሰማይ፡ ወእንግርከ።
ወትስማዕ፡ ምድር፡ ቃል፡ አፉየ።
msItem.explicit:
ወአምዕዑኒ፡ በአማልክቲሆሙ።
ወአነ፡ አቀንዖሙ፡ በዘኢኮነ፡ ሕዝብ።
ወአምዕዖሙ፡ ለሕዝብ፡ በዘኢይሌብዉ።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ዘሣልስ፡ ሕግ።
፫ እስመ፡ እሳት፡ ትነድድ፡ እመዐትየ።
ወታውዒ፡ እስከ፡ ሲኦል፡ ታሕተ።
msItem.explicit:
ይትቤቀል፡ ወይትፈደይ፡ በቀለ፡ ለፀሩ፡
ወይትቤቀሎሙ፡ ለፀላእቱ።
ወያነጽሕ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምድረ፡ ለሕዝቡ።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሐና፡ እመ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ነቢይ።
፬፡ ጸንዓ፡ ልብየ፡ በእግዚአብሔር።
ወተለዓለ፡ ቀርንየ፡ በአምላኪየ፡ ወመድኃንየ።
msItem.explicit:
ወውእቱ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ይኴንን፡ እስከ፡ አጽናፈ፡ ምድር።
ወይሁቦሙ፡ ኃይለ፡ ለነገሥትነ።
ወያሌዕል፡ ቀርነ፡ መሢሑ።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሕዝቅያስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ይሁዳ።
፭፡ አንሰ፡ እቤ፡ በኑኃ፡ መዋዕልየ።
ውስተ፡ አናቅጸ፡ ሲኦል፡ ኀደጉ፡ ዘተረፈ፡ ዓመትየ።
msItem.explicit:
እነግር፡ ጽድቀከ፡ በዳኅናየ።
ወትረ፡ እሴብሐከ፡ ወእዜምር፡ ለከ።
በኵሉ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሕይወትየ። በቅድመ፡ ቤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ምናሴ፡ ነቢይ።
፮፡ እግዚኦ፡ አኃዜ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዓለም።
አምላኮሙ፡ ለአበዊነ። ለአብርሃም፡ ወለይስሐቅ፡ ወለያዕቆብ።
msItem.explicit:
እሴብሐከ፡ በኵሉ፡ ጊዜ፡ ወበኵሉ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሐይወትየ።
እስመ፡ ኪያከ፡ ይሴብሑ፡ ኵሉ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሰማያት።
ወለከ፡ ሰብሐት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ዮናስ፡ ነቢይ።
፯፡ ጸራኅኩ፡ በምንዳቤየ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላኪየ።
ወሰምዓኒ፡ በወለተ፡ ከርሠ፡ ሲኦል።
msItem.explicit:
እስከ፡ ዓቀቡ፡ ከንቶ፡ ወሐሰተ፡ ገደፉ፡ ሣህሎሙ።
አንሰ፡ ምስለ፡ ቃለ፡ ሰብሐት፡ በተጋንዮ፡ እሠውዕ፡ ለከ።
መጠነ፡ ጸለይኩ፡ በሕይወትየ፡ አዓሥዮ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ዳንኤል፡ ነቢይ፡ ስብሐት፡ ዘእምአዛርያ።
፰ ይትባረክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላከ፡ አበዊነ።
እኵት፡ ወስቡሕ፡ ስምከ፡ ለዓለም።
msItem.explicit:
ይትኃፈሩ፡ በኵሉ፡ ትእግልቶሙ፡ ወይትቀጥቅጥ።
ወያእምሩ፡ ከመ፡ አንተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላክ፡ ባሕቲትከ።
ስቡሕ፡ በኵሉ፡ ምድር፡ ወበኵሉ፡ ዓለም።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ደቂቅ።
፱፡ ይትባረክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላከ፡ አበዊነ።
ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም።
msItem.explicit:
ስቡሕኒ፡ አንተ፡ ወቡሩክ፡ አንተ፡ ለዓለም።
ቡሩክ፡ አንተ፡ በመልዕልተ፡ ሰማያት።
ስቡሕኒ፡ አንተ፡ ወክቡርኒ፡ አንተ፡ ለዓለም።

msItem.incipit:
ኀበ፡ ባረኩ፡ አናንያ፡ ወአዛርያ፡ ወሚሳኤል። ለእግዚአብሔር።
፲ይ ባርክዎ፡ ኵሉ፡ ግብረ፡ እግዚእ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።
ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም።
msItem.explicit:
ይባርክዎ፡ አናንያ፡ ወአዛርያ፡ ወሚሳኤል፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።
ንባርኮ፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ።
ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ እንባቆም፡ ነቢይ።
፲፩ እግዚኦ፡ ሰማዕኩ፡ ድምፀከ፡ ወፈራህኩ።
ርኢኩ፡ ግብረከ፡ ወአንከርኩ።
msItem.explicit:
እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላኪየ፡ ወኃይልየ።
ዘይሠርዖን፡ ለእገርየ፡ ወለፍጻሜየ።
ወዲበ፡ ልዑላት፡ ያጼዕነኒ። ከመ፡ እማዕ፡ በመኃልዪሁ።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ኢሳይያስ፡ ነቢይ።
፲፪ በሌሊት፡ ትገይስ፡ መንፈስየ፡ ኀቤከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ አምላኪየ።
እስመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ትእዛዝከ፡ በዲበ፡ ምድር።
msItem.explicit:
ሑር፡ ሕዝብየ፡ ወባእ፡ ቤተከ። ወዕፁ፡ ኆኅተከ።
ወተኃባእ፡ ሕዳጠ፡ ምዕረ።
እስከ፡ የኃልፍ፡ መዐዓቱ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ።
፲፫፡ ተዓብዮ፡ ነፍስየ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።
ወትትኃሠይ፡ መንፈስየ፡ በአምላኪየ፡ ወመድኃንየ።
msItem.explicit:
ወተወክፎ፡ ለእስራኤል፡ ቍልዔሁ።
ወተዘከረ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ዘይቤሎሙ፡ ለአበዊነ።
ለአብርሃም፡ ወለዘርኡ፡ እስለ፡ ለዓለም።

msItem.incipit:
ጸሎተ፡ ዘካርያስ፡ ነቢይ።
፲፬ ይትባረክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምላከ፡ እስራኤል።
ዘተሠሃለኒ፡ ወገብረ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ለሕዝበ፡ ዚአሁ።
msItem.explicit:
ለዘሐወጸነ፡ እምአርያም። ወሠረቀ፡ ከመ፡ ያርእዮሙ፡ ብርሃኖ።
ለእለ፡ ይነብሩ፡ ውስተ፡ ጽልመት፡ ወጽላሎተ፡ ሞት።
ከመ፡ ያርትዕ፡ እገረነ፡ ውስተ፡ ፍኖተ፡ ሰላም።

msItem.incipit:
፲፭ ጸሎተ፡ ስምዖን፡ ነቢይ።
ይእዜ፡ ትሥዕሮ፡ ለገብርከ። በሰላም፡ እግዚኦ፡
msItem.explicit:
ዘአስተዳሎከ፡ ቅድመ፡ ኵሉ፡ ሕዝብከ።
ከመ፡ ትክሥት፡ ብርሃነ፡ ለአሕዛብ።
ወክብረ፡ ለሕዝብከ፡ እስራኤል።

msItem.incipit:
መኀልየ፡ መኀልይ፡ ዝውእቱ፡ ዘሰሎሞን።
፩፡ ይስዕመኒ፡ በስዕመተ፡ አፉሁ።
አዳም፡ አጥባትኪ፡ እምወይን።
msItem.explicit:
እንዘ፡ ይነብር፡ ውስተ፡ ገነት፡ ካልአን፡ ረይዎ።
ቃለከ፡ አስምዓኒ።
ጕይ፡ አንተ፡ ወልድ፡ እኁየ፡ ወተመሰላ፡ ለወይጠል።
ወእመ፡ አኮ፡ ከመ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ኃይል፡ ውስተ፡ አድባረ፡ ድሁኃን።

msItem.incipit: ውዳሴ፡ ዘሰኑይ፡ ፈቀደ፡ እግዚእ፡ ያግዕዞ፡ ለአዳም፡ ኅዙነ፡ ወትኩዘ፡ ልብ፡ ወያግብኦ፡ ኀበ፡ ዘትካት፡ መንበሩ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት። ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርዓ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኃነነ።
msItem.explicit: ወረሰይካ፡ ለሔዋን፡ አግዓዚተ፡ እምፃዕረ፡ ሞት፡ ወወሀብከነ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ልደት፡ ባረክናከ፡ ምስለ፡ መላእክቲከ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት።

msItem.incipit: ውዳሴ፡ ዘዓርብ። ቡርክት፡ አንቲ፡ እምአንስት፡ ወቡሩክ፡ ፍሬ፡ ከርሥኪ፡ ኦማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ርኵስ፡ ሠረቀ፡ ለነ፡ እምኔኪ፡ ፀሐየ፡ ጽድቅ። ወአቅረበነ፡ ታሕተ፡ ክነፊሁ።
msItem.explicit: በእንተዝ፡ ንዌድስኪ፡ በከመ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፡ እንዘ፡ ንብል፡ ቡርክት፡ አንቲ፡ ማርያም፡ ወቡሩክ፡ ፍሬ፡ ከርሥኪ። ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕተ፡ ጸጋ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ። ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ።

msItem.incipit: ውዳሴ፡ ዘቀዳሚት፡ ሰንበት። ንጽሕት፡ ወብርዘት፡ ወቅድስት፡ በኵሉ፡ እንተ፡ ሐቀፈቶ፡ ለእግዚእ፡ በእራኅ። ወኵሉ፡ ፍጥረት፡ ይትፌሥሑ፡ ምስሌሃ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸርሑ፡ ወይብሉ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ።
msItem.explicit: ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ኀበ፡ ወልድኪ፡ ኄር፡ መድኃኒነ፡ ይምሐረነ፡ ወይሣሃለነ፡ ይሥረይ፡ ኃጢአተነ። ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ።

msItem.incipit: ውዳሴ፡ ዘሰንበት፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ተሰመይኪ፡ ፍቅርተ፡ ኦቡርክት፡ እምአንስት። አንቲ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዳግሚት፡ ቀመር፡ እንተ፡ ትሰመይ፡ ቅድስተ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወውስቴታ፡ ጽላተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ፲ ቃላት፡ እለ፡ ተጽሕፉ፡ በአፃብዒሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር።
msItem.explicit: ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ያጽንዓነ፡ በርትዕት፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ውስተ፡ አሚነ፡ ዚአሁ። ይጸግወነ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ወምሕረቶ፡ ይስረይ፡ ኃጢአተነ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ምሕረቱ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት።

msItem.incipit: ውዳሴ፡ ወግናይ፡ እሙ፡ ለአዶናይ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወብፅዕት፡ ስብሕት፡ ወቡርክት፡ ክብርት፡ ወልዕልት፡ አንቀጸ፡ ብርሃን፡ ማዓርገ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወማኅደረ፡ መለኮት፡ ቅድስተ፡ ቅዱሳን። አንቲ፡ ውእቱ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ ተሰመይኪ፡ ሥምረተ፡ አብ፡
msItem.explicit: አንቲ፡ በአማን፡ ዘኮንኪ፡ ምክህ፡ ለዘምደ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ወብኪ፡ ቅሩባነ፡ ኮነ፡ እምድር፡ ለማኅደር፡ ውስተ፡ አርያም፡ በእንተ፡ ተሠግዎቱ፡ ለወልደ፡ አምላክ፡ አምኔኪ፡ ስዕለት፡ ለነፍሳቲነ፡ ሕይወተ፡ ኦጸጋዊተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ለእለ፡ የ
msItem.note: The text ends abruptly due to material loss.

extent.note: Data on the dimensions of folios taken from .

supportDesc.foliation: Pencil foliation in the upper right corner carried out by the Bodleian Library in January 2020 (i–iii+1–137).

collation.signatures: Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper inner margin of the first folio of each quire. Some of them are nearly illegible.

list.item:
3
3 added A parchment guard is placed around the quire, to which has been sewn.

1
1, two stubs before 1 Two stubs are found between the first folio, which is cut out, and

supportDesc.condition: Humidity appears to have damaged the parchment, especially towards the end of the manuscript. Some folios are slightly stained with dirt, e.g. on , or wax, e.g. on . The text is occasionally barely legible, e.g. on . Some letters have been washed away and poorly rewritten in a secondary hand on . Traces of intensive use.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are visible. Both primary and ruling pricks are visible.
The upper and bottom lines are written above the ruling.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are visible. Both primary and ruling pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.date: First half of the nineteenth century.
handNote.desc: Fine handwriting, sometimes uneven in size and thickness (e.g. on ). The graphemes ግ and ዚ in the word እግዚአብሔር፡ are occasionally written with ligature (e.g. on ).
handNote.seg: Several groups of lines on the incipit pages, alternating with black lines; numbers and titles of the psalms and of the canticles; incipits and numbers of the songs; holy names; the word መንፈቁ፡ indicating the midpoint of the Psalms of David; names, numbers, and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps 118; some letters, alternating with black letters, of the first word of each line (generally ይባርክዎ፡) of the Third song of the Three Youths; elements of the punctuation signs, text dividers, and numerals, included quire marks.
handNote.ab: Groups of ten psalms are separated sometimes with one chain of red and black small semicircles (e.g. on ), sometimes with two chains of red and black small semicircles (), or sometimes with one single chain of red semicircles ().

list.item: እግ, እግዚ or እግዚአ for እግዚአብሔር፡ (e.g. );
ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅድ፡ or ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g. );
ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g. ).

decoDesc.summary: The manuscript contains four framed miniatures that were executed by the same hand and that are comparable to one executed about a century later than the text and opening headpiece (88).

decoNote.desc: A portrait of David with a sword.
Bichrome interlace band topped by abstract and irregularly arranged floral motifs.
Bichrome band filled with flower elements and hourglass motifs.

item.desc: Note mentioning the angels, the martyrs, the Four Living Beasts, the Twenty-Four Heavenly Priests, the fifteen prophets, the twelve apostles, the four evangelists, the 318 Fathers, and John the Baptist. The text is incomplete: it starts and ends abruptly. It might be the continuation of Additional note 2. Some letters are hardly legible.
item.q: ት፡ ሃይማኖት። ወጸሐፍ፡ አስማቲሆሙ፡ ምስለ፡ መላእክት፡ ወሰማዕት፡ በጸሎታ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። በሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ወበገዜናዊ፡ ትፍሥሕት፡ በሱራፌል፡ ወበኪሩቤል። ወበ፬ እንስሳ። ወበ፳ወ፬ ካህናተ፡ ሰማይ። ወበጸሎቶሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ ወመላእክት። በ፲ወ፭ ነቢያት። ፲ወ፪ ሐዋርያት። ወበ፬ ወንጌላውያን። ወበ፫፻፲ወ፰ ማኅበረ፡ ቅዱሳን። ወበቅዱስ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ። ድንግል፡ ወካህን፡ ወ

item.desc: Note written in the same hand as Additional note 1, prescribing the reading of the ‘Prayer of penance’ (perhaps ) and containing formulas concerning the remission of sins.
item.q: ታንብብ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ንስሐ። ወትብል፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወአምላክነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። ንስእለከ፡ ወናስተበቍዓከ፡ በእንተ፡ እሉ፡ አግብርቲከ፡ አበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ እለ፡ ቆሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያንከ፡ ቅድስት፡ እለ፡ ሀለዉ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ጸሎት፡ ወይኩኑ፡ ፍቱሐነ፡ በአፈ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወበአፈ፡ ዚአየኒ፡ አነ፡ ገብርከ፡ ኃጥእ። እገሌ። ባርኮሙ፡ ወስረይ፡ ኃጢአቶሙ፡ ዘገብሩ፡ በአእምሮ፡ እመሂ፡ በቃል። አው፡ በምግባር፡ ወእመሂ፡ በሕሊና። ፍትሖሙ፡ እግዚአ

item.desc: Psalms are all numbered, except for Ps 87 (). Ps 138 is erroneously indicated as 137 (). The midpoint of the Psalms of David is indicated with the word መንፈቁ፡, encircled in red ink, on .
Some words are poorly written in green ink and mostly effaced at the side of the text.
Writings in a blue pen, in a poor hand, on the upper and lower margin of the text area.

A white sticker is glued to the inner side of the front board. The name of is printed on it (‘ቤንት፡ ዩውል፡ የንሰን።’) and the signature ‘MS. Aeth. e. 30’ is written in pencil. An additional sticker, with the signature ‘Ms 10’ on it, is glued below it. The subject of the miniatures, shelfmark, textual content and dating of the book (‘Miniatures: David with his sling. David killing Potiphar + St. Michael. Ethiopian MS-10, Early-mid 19. Psalter’), barely legible, are indicated in pencil on .

binding.decoNote: The book is bound in wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather and enclosed in a textile chemise.
The boards are cut to the same size as the bookblock and present external shallow bevels. The grain runs vertically.

Reddish-brown upper and lower leather cover, the back is missing. The turn-ins have been trimmed out and at the corners form butt mitres. The two edges are then sewn together. The cover shows a faint blind tooled decoration, identical on both sides of the cover. The turn-ins are decorated as well. The decoration consists in three concentric frames surrounding a central rectangular panel featuring a Latin cross. Frames composed by the repetition of single hand tools enclosed between double straight lines alternate with empty ones. The outer frame presents a criss-cross motif while in the inner frame wavy lines form an interlaced motif. The arms of the cross are formed by the repetition of X-Form between possibly single straight lines. Double circles are printed at the intersections of the double straight lines and at the end of the arms of the cross. The turn-ins are decorated with single straight lines crossing each other. The book is wrapped in a protective flower-printed cotton chemise with a long stripe extending from the tailcap to cover the three edges of the codex.

Chainstitch sewing on four sewing stations (two pairs); periodic fold pattern. Two Z-plied threads are used. The sewing starts from the first quire where, for each pair of sewing stations, there is one length of thread in the centre-fold, while in the rest of the quires there are two. The notches cut in the upper and lower cover in correspondence with the board attachment sites indicate that the attachment has been repaired removing only the back cover.
The rows of holes close to the head and tail of the quires could indicate the former presence of endbands or quire tackets.
A red leaf tab marker is inserted in the upper outer corner of .

history.origin: early–mid-nineteenth century The manuscript can be dated palaeographically to the early–mid-nineteenth century.
history.provenance: Unknown provenance. The manuscript was purchased by under unknown circumstances.

Added rubric, page break; corrected add place="right"
Updated binding, layout, ruling and pricking, extra.
Revisions by Dorothea Reule, Massimo Villa, Jonas Karlsson, Eliana Dal Sasso, Jacopo Gnisci and Susanne Hummel as part of the project ‘A Catalogue of the Manuscript Collection of Bent Juel-Jensen’
